website_summaries.verdict: A heavy-duty, affordable live center with lots of satisfied owners.
cons: Occasional complaints about quality of bearings and a high-pitched noise emanating from the live center

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement for an old tool
customer_reviews.text: I got this to replace the tailstock on a 60+ year old Dewalt Lathe. Works great, and was a perfect fit, except for one problem. The end plate that covers the internal bearings unscrews while it's being used. No idea if it was properly torqued from the factory or not, nor do I know what torque it should be at, nor a tool to tighten it properly. I put a dab of BLUE locktite on the threads and tightened it down as best as I could. Hopefully that keeps it from coming loose again.
customer_reviews.author: Jeddidiah Stolzfus

customer_reviews.title: Broken Live Center
customer_reviews.text: This live center Broke in half while turning on my Lathe what can be done about it?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Falls Apart While In Use ....Do Not Purchase!
customer_reviews.text: The bearing retainer came loose I rethreaded it back on and it keeps coming apart everytime I use it. Poor design and would not recommend it to anyone. I have not contacted PSI but intend to do so ....just thought I would share my experience with this tailstock. Disappointed because people were giving it good reviews, I noticed one person had the same problem and he rethreaded it......I rethreaded the backer plate 20 times and it keeps coming loose everytime I use it. I can't return it because I purchased it a while back and didn't use it for a couple of months. So, I guess I'm screwed.
customer_reviews.author: Scott P.

customer_reviews.title: I've had issues with the bearing cap coming unscrewed due ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had issues with the bearing cap coming unscrewed due to vibrations while turning. Even after re-tightening using a pair of snap ring pliers, the cap continued to rotate loose. I finally cleaned the threads, then used some blue thread-locker, this resolved the issue. Otherwise this center works very well, smooth bearings and no noticeable play.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff R

customer_reviews.title: Not for turning metal - good for wood though!
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent live center, especially considering it cost less than $20. the runout was less than .001, bearings were smooth and acceptably quiet. The metal this live center is made from is far, far too soft for turning metal. Do not buy this if you intend to use it on a metal lathe. My center was basically destroyed the first time I used it with stainless steel. It is now used for roughing woodwork because I can not return it. This would be pretty good for woodwork that requires a live center, but that is the limit of its usefulness.
customer_reviews.author: E. B.

customer_reviews.title: well made tool, especially for this price
customer_reviews.text: Everything seems to work nicely, bearings are smooth, taper fits perfectly in my benchtop lathe. The only problem i had was the tip of the center head poked through the thin foam, and cardboard box, and was flattened. Luckily, buying this tool for a lathe, i simply threw it in my chuck, and touched some 100 grit sandpaper followed by some 400 grit, and it looks almost perfect again. All the actual funtional parts seem unharmed though, so not too much trouble, especially for the price point. I would recommend, seeing as anyone buying this product would be able to fix it using the machine it is used for.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa G.

customer_reviews.title: Short stem?
customer_reviews.text: Either the stem is very short on this live center or my 2MT socket's tool release access port is positioned too far back, but I had to Super Glue a 7/16" nut onto the very end of the stem (shown in photo) so that it would extend into the slot opening to be able to pry-release the unit from the socket. (If your socket/holder has both ends open, just a tap with a dowel from the rear will work just fine!) The unit itself appears to be very well made...although I have yet to actual use the live center on a project to be able to report on the ever-loosening bearing cap issue.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S Mathras

customer_reviews.title: Way better than stock
customer_reviews.text: Well worth whatever I paid for it!! I have noticed this same live center on LOTS of Youtube videos so it must be pretty popular, and reliable. Some of those guys are pros that have been lathin' for years and they would know better than this beginner!
customer_reviews.author: michael crippen

customer_reviews.title: Good tool, poor package.
customer_reviews.text: Like many other reviews, the center was packed in a a small cardboard box with a thin piece of foam over the tip. The tip had gone through the foam and the cardboard and was flattened. Fortunately, the damage was minimal and I'm able to use it. I'll take a moment to try to grind the tip sharp again. I wanted to use this to be able to take off the chuck tenon on my turnings. Since there is a center indentation in the tenon, the center still fits in. Performance-wise, I give this five stars. But I take one away for the poor packaging.
customer_reviews.author: R. ODonnell

customer_reviews.title: Good bearings
customer_reviews.text: Initially I was disappointed with this thing because it would not fit my lathe. The disappointment was my fault though, as I thought I had ordered a 3MT, upon rechecking my order, I found the mistake (on my part). Having screwed up, I chose to keep it because the spinning head is actually solid, and rolling on what seem to be really high quality bearings. It was a simple matter to get a sleeve for the 2MT shaft that adapts it to 3MT. I have used it a couple times now and I am pleased with it, especially at such a cheap price.
customer_reviews.author: big daddy

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last 5 months. Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: My wife bought this live center for me as a Christmas present. And I've used it to turn about 20 pens which is very few. I was using it today and I started to hear a growling sound. I stopped my lathe and replace the center with my spare started the lathe and the growling sound was gone I put the PSI center back on and the sound returned. I do not repeat do not recommend this item. Mine is going in the trash since I can't return it. Thankfully I have my spare so I can finish my project.
customer_reviews.author: Evelyn

customer_reviews.title: Packaging is awful and the point was damaged!
customer_reviews.text: Product seems well made but the way in which it was delivered was awful! Anyone looking to buy one of these will probably already know it’s pretty heavy and with the spike on the end it pierces through the packaging and in my case it happens twice! And the point was damaged! I returned the first one and I’m debating on what to do now! Do I file it the best I can or return to see if it will be ok the 3rd time?
customer_reviews.author: Medler family

customer_reviews.title: Machine tool heaven
customer_reviews.text: As craftsman and machinist for over four decades, I have worked with many types of lathe, both wood turning and metal lathes, from micro Unimat to 18” swing LeBlonds, Cadillac, and many more. I found this live center to be very solid and silent. It is just the thing for this or any application.
customer_reviews.author: Health Advocate

customer_reviews.title: Quick easy fix for expanding my lathe use
customer_reviews.text: This is not a heavy duty center for a 20 hp machine tool. But with a small #2 Morse taper it is well within the scope of all expected performance needs. It’s value is... if you need it once you should own it. Many similar ones cost more but they are no better in use. Thank You all for a fast easy purchase and quality product for a great price...
customer_reviews.author: Ed S

customer_reviews.title: It works fine but you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: I know it’s advertised as a woodworking tool but I used it on a metal lathe. It worked for what I needed it for but the tip seems kind of soft, it has a slight ring of wear on it after one use. Also, the bearings aren’t great and it seemed to have a very slight wobble so don’t expect high precision. Lastly, the taper was a little long so I lost probably an additional 3/8-1/2” of tailstock travel. Overall I’m satisfied for the price and knew not to expect high precision.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: No run out
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for turning some pieces with a larger than usual through hole, run out was not noticed and indicator confirms this, very nice live center at an economical price
customer_reviews.author: J Bryant

customer_reviews.title: Great live center
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my Craftsman tube lathe which seems to be the only lathe on the planet that was built with 1MT tapers, This live center works great, and I would buy it 1000 times over! For everyone complaining about the detent feeling, that goes away after the first time you run it.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Gantt (TheMakersWorkbench)

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I used this for my wood lathe and turning pens between centers. I've owned this less then a year but even with the first use the areas of contact started to deform. Which means this live center is NOT hardened. It is a softer material then my stainless bushings. Sure enough I took a file to it and it left a gouge. If you are planing on using this for just wood then you should be fine. But if you plan on using this to hold and apply pressure to metal just like pen TBC bushings. Then I would pass this up and spend the extra bucks and get a hardened one.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Seeuwen

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and good machine finish
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality machined part. The bearings are silent and spins easily with no slop or play. The machine finish is very good and smooth with no noticeable tooling marks. The metal is hard and the point on the center is very pointy and sharp. It's worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Bittle

customer_reviews.title: Nice tool
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in perfect condition. Started using it immediately. Yes I'd recommend this tool to others. It seems to be well made and worth the money. If anything changes I'll update the review.
customer_reviews.author: roborant

customer_reviews.title: Need thread-locker and you have a quality piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.text: Very nicely built and works great. It would been a 5 star but the back plate unscrewed immediately. It take a little dab of thread-locker to keep It tight. Left hand threads might solve the problem, but at least the manufacturer should do the little fix of the problem. Most all other comments had to deal with the same issue.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Scribner

customer_reviews.title: Solid, good quality for home use
customer_reviews.text: I read the other reviews of this tailstock and the problems they describe but all I can say is I have been using it for several months and it is working perfectly. The taper is handy for getting close to the end of a small diameter workpiece. It is reasonably priced and good quality for home use.
customer_reviews.author: D. Kam

customer_reviews.title: Nice addition to my lathe accessories
customer_reviews.text: After using it a few times the slight catch in the spin is no longer there. It turns smoothly and does a good job of holding the piece after a large hole has been drilled in the tail stock end. Well made and heavy duty.
customer_reviews.author: Dano

customer_reviews.title: Great piece of gear
customer_reviews.text: Bought this a couple of months and have used it to make half a dozen rolling pins. It just seems like one of those rock-solid pieces of gear...accurate, smooth, and will probably last my lifetime. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Baker

customer_reviews.title: Happy with purchase

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade for your lathe

customer_reviews.title: Does the job seems prone to rusting

Bearings are smooth enough for woodturning. Taper seems smooth and straight. This thing rusts though, I mean it rusts fast! I keep paste was on this and it still rusts, so basically this requires a weekly cleanup with 400 grit paper and waxing. I wish it was not so rust prone, maybe a coat of black oxide would help or something.

customer_reviews.title: Works 100%, looks 90%
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product for the price. Is it as refined as some of the more expensive versions? No, it is not. However, that does not mean it will not do the same job just as well and honestly, do you need it to have a perfect finish, etc. to do what it's designed to do? No, you do not. If you need a new live center for your lathe, you will not go wrong with this one.
customer_reviews.author: R. W. Galloway

customer_reviews.title: My Main Live Center
customer_reviews.text: This has become my main live center for my mini Jet (1014). The angle allows me to get in close for minimal clean up on turning projects. I've not detected any run out and would recommend this for anyone looking for a good center at a reasonable price.

I do a lot of fishing lures and bottle stoppers and this kind of center makes a huge difference in effiency and results. This piece is very heavy and looks like it will last a lifetime. Small warning which is just the tip is pinpoint sharp! Like everything else in woodturning, pay attention to what you're doing...

customer_reviews.title: Solidly Built
